alert.note: Alert for Southern Seward Peninsula Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 29 at 5:11AM AKDT until March 30 at 12:00PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow with low visibility. Total snow accumulations 4 to 7 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. Visibility one half mile or less at times. * WHERE...Southern Seward Peninsula Coast. * WHEN...Until noon AKDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Snow drifts will form. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow and blowing snow is causing low visibility this morning that will continue into this afternoon. Winds will decrease this evening, but snow will continue through Thursday morning. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow down and use caution while traveling. &&
